member.name: T:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.TypeFilterLevel
member.summary: Specifies the level of automatic deserialization for .NET Framework remoting.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.TypeFilterLevel.Full
member.summary: The full deserialization level for .NET Framework remoting. It supports all types that remoting supports in all situations.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.TypeFilterLevel.Low
member.summary: The low deserialization level for .NET Framework remoting. It supports types associated with basic remoting functionality.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.FormatterTypeStyle
member.summary: Indicates the format in which type descriptions are laid out in the serialized stream.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.FormatterTypeStyle.TypesAlways
member.summary: Indicates that types can be given to all object members and object members.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.FormatterTypeStyle.TypesWhenNeeded
member.summary: Indicates that types can be stated only for arrays of objects, object members of type , and non-primitive value types.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.FormatterTypeStyle.XsdString
member.summary: Indicates that strings can be given in the XSD format rather than SOAP. No string IDs are transmitted.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.FormatterAssemblyStyle
member.summary: Indicates the method that will be used during deserialization for locating and loading assemblies.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.FormatterAssemblyStyle.Full
member.summary: In full mode, the assembly used during deserialization must match exactly the assembly used during serialization. The method of the class is used to load the assembly.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.FormatterAssemblyStyle.Simple
member.summary: In simple mode, the assembly used during deserialization need not match exactly the assembly used during serialization. Specifically, the version numbers need not match as the method is used to load the assembly.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatter.WriteInt64(System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a 64-bit signed integer to the stream.
member.param: The value to write.
The name of the member.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatter.WriteMember(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Inspects the type of data received, and calls the appropriate method to perform the write to the stream already attached to the formatter.
member.param: The name of the member to serialize.
The object to write to the stream attached to the formatter.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatter.WriteObjectRef(System.Object,System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes an object reference to the stream already attached to the formatter.
member.param: The object reference to write.
The name of the member.
The type of object the reference points to.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes an 8-bit signed integer to the stream already attached to the formatter.
member.param: The value to write.
The name of the member.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatter.WriteSingle(System.Single,System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a single-precision floating-point number to the stream already attached to the formatter.
member.param: The value to write.
The name of the member.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a value to the stream already attached to the formatter.

The name of the member.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatter.WriteValueType(System.Object,System.String,System.Type)
